page.title: 16ROSE CASTLE: FEATURES
page.content: The{Main Lawn }is the old courtyard, and beneath this lawn are the old cellars which have been closed off for about a hundred years. The Bishop has tried and failed to enter these cellars; he intends to try again from the side. There is rumoured to be a passage from Rose to Lime House and the Bishop hopes to find this when he enters the cellars. The church owns six acres of land around the Rose on which the Bishop keeps a small flock of sheep. He also owns two dogs. The Bishop has a gardener and a chauffeur who work for him. Their wives, along with the Bishop's wife, look after the housework in the Rose.
